document_data.name: House Karanok
document_data.leader:
[[Maelos Karanok]] c. [[1372 DR]])
[[Shala Karanok]] c. [[1479 DR]]
document_data.mainbody: '''House Karanok''' was the insane ruling family of the city of [[Luthcheq]] in [[Chessenta]]. They claimed to be pure-blood [[Mulan]] and descendants of the [[god]]-king [[Nanna-Sin]].{{Cite dungeon/178/Backdrop: Chessenta|69}}
document_data.Organization: They believed that [[wizard]]s (including also [[sorcerer]]s, [[dwarves]], and [[elves]]) were evil and must be burned. They worshiped [[Entropy]], a strange ''[[sphere of annihilation]]''. In [[1370 DR]], [[Tiamat]] posed as Entropy and granted them clerical [[spell]]s.{{Cite dungeon/178/Backdrop: Chessenta|71}}
document_data.Members:
In [[1357 DR]]:
* [[Jaerios Karanok]]
* [[Maelos Karanok]]
* [[Naeros Karanok]]
* [[Saestra Karanok]]
In [[1372 DR]]:
* [[Kaestra Karanok]]
* [[Povros Karanok]]
After the [[Spellplague]]:
* [[Ishual Karanok]]
* [[Shala Karanok]]
document_data.History:
The Karanoks became the rulers of Luthcheq under suspicious circumstances in the {{YearlinkName|1161}}. Initially, they ruled in a typical Chessentan style.

In the {{YearlinkName|1324}}, however, Luthcheq was defeated in a war against [[Mordulkin]] and the Karanoks blamed wizard spies for their loss. With this, they started their crusade against [[arcane]] [[magic]].

Then, in the {{YearlinkName|1346}}, from nowhere, Entropy manifested itself inside House Karanok's mansion, killing a wizard they were torturing. The Karanoks saw this as an omen and began worshiping it.

[[Tiamat]] started granting clerical powers to the Karanoks in the {{YearlinkName|1370}}, in order to manipulate them.

Then everything changed after [[Tchazzar]] disappeared in the chaos of the [[Spellplague]] in the {{YearlinkName|1385}}. Ishual Karanok emerged as a war hero and leader who united the divided survivors of Luthcheq. He went on to battle rampaging monsters, [[aberration]]s sent by the [[Abolethic Sovereignty]], and opportunistic invaders and colonists from northern lands, and so kept Chessenta alive.{{Cite dungeon/178/Backdrop: Chessenta|70}} In the {{YearlinkName|1399}}, Ishual Karanok merged the different coinages of the city-states of Chessenta into a single currency.{{Cite dungeon/178/Backdrop: Chessenta|69}} After a time, when the fighting had lessened, he returned to Luthcheq and the Karanok family home. There, Ishual disbanded his family's cult, arguing that their goal of destroying all arcane [[magic]] and its users had been achieved with [[Mystra (Midnight)|Mystra's]] death. Nevertheless, he kept their god Entropy as a symbol of power.

In [[1479 DR]], the ruler [[Shala Karanok]] was ousted from power for a brief time by the returned Tchazzar. However, after the [[Battle of Luthcheq]], she regained control over the city.
